status_definitions.completed: Requirement fully addressed, documented, and ready for submission
status_definitions.not_started: No work begun on this requirement
status_definitions.statutory_boilerplate: Standard FAR/VAAR clause, no action required beyond acknowledgment
status_definitions.already_addressed: Covered in existing proposal content or project documentation
status_definitions.review_required: Needs careful review to ensure compliance
status_definitions.critical_blocker: Must be completed or proposal will be rejected

team_definitions.contracts: Teaming agreements, OEM letters, past performance, legal compliance, amendments
team_definitions.technical_writing: Volume I narrative, Volume II, documentation, page management, formatting
team_definitions.software_dev: Platform features, technical capabilities, mobile apps, D.1 functionality responses
team_definitions.security: FedRAMP, ATO, FIPS-199, encryption, data protection, VA security requirements
team_definitions.integrations: EntraID, Active Directory, MDM, SSO, APIs, interoperability
team_definitions.project_management: Timeline, milestones, coordination, deliverables schedule, kickoff planning
team_definitions.product_delivery: Implementation, 90-day rollout, training, change management, go-live
team_definitions.support_operations: Help desk, 24/7 support model, SLAs, user support, OMS&E
team_definitions.pricing: CLIN structure, license costs, work split calculation, Volume III completion
team_definitions.compliance: FAR/VAAR requirements, certifications, representations, SDVOSB verification
team_definitions.finance: Invoicing, payment terms, accounting, appropriation data

rfp_sections.description: SF 1449 Cover Sheet - Solicitation/Contract/Order for Commercial Products and Services
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must be completed and signed for Volume IV
requirements: Complete blocks 30a-30c (Signature, name/title, date) for Volume IV
rfp_sections.notes: Critical for Volume IV submission. Must be signed by authorized representative. Do NOT sign until ready to submit.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from Cover Page addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: RFP document structure and navigation
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Reference only - helps navigate RFP structure
rfp_sections.notes: No action required. Use for reference to find specific sections.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Acknowledged and tracked, no action required

rfp_sections.section_name: Section B - Schedule of Supplies and Services
rfp_sections.description: CLINs structure, quantities, units, pricing framework
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Forms basis of Volume III Price Schedule. Must understand work split.
requirements: CLIN 0001: Messaging Software Application (20,000 NTE licenses)
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL: License costs count toward 50% SDVOSB self-performance calculation per Q&A #2. RPR Tech must perform >50% of TOTAL contract value including all CLINs and option years.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from Section B - Schedule of Supplies and Services addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Legal framework and dispute resolution
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: No proposal response required - contract terms only
rfp_sections.notes: Standard boilerplate. No action required for proposal.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Acknowledged and tracked, no action required

rfp_sections.section_name: B.3 Software License, Maintenance and Technical Support
rfp_sections.description: License grant terms, maintenance requirements, support obligations
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Informs Volume I support model and Volume III licensing terms
requirements: Grant perpetual license if hosted on-premise (N/A for SaaS)
Provide maintenance and technical support for base + options
Software updates and patches at no additional cost
Security updates within timeframes per PWS
rfp_sections.notes: SaaS model means perpetual license clause is N/A per Q&A responses. Focus on support model in Volume I Section 7.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.3 Software License, Maintenance and Technical Support addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: VA context, current pager system limitations, modernization drivers
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Use to demonstrate understanding in Volume I Executive Summary and Section 1
requirements: Understand VA operates 103 VISN medical facilities
Current pager system limitations (one-way, no security, aging infrastructure)
Need for modern two-way secure messaging
rfp_sections.notes: Demonstrate deep understanding of VA's challenges in Volume I. Reference Q&A #53 - this is a NEW requirement with no incumbent.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Section reviewed and understood

rfp_sections.description: Reference standards, VA handbooks, security requirements, compliance frameworks
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must reference compliance with these standards in Volume I Sections 4 & 5
requirements: VA Directive 6004: Network and Perimeter Security
VA Directive 6513: Vulnerability and Patch Management
rfp_sections.notes: Critical compliance framework. Volume I Sections 4 and 5 must explicitly address compliance with each applicable standard. Use VA_Security_Compliance_Reference_Guide.md for details.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.2 Applicable Documents addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: High-level scope, up to 20,000 licenses, 103 sites, SaaS delivery model
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Foundation for entire Volume I technical approach
requirements: Meet FedRAMP Moderate and FIPS-199 Moderate
rfp_sections.notes: Core scope well understood. Addressed in Volume I Executive Summary and Section 1.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.3 Scope of Work addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Core messaging features: individual, group, broadcast, priority routing
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must address in Volume I Section 2 (D.1 Functionality Checklist)
rfp_sections.notes: PENDING: Movius platform feature specifications needed to complete D.1 responses. Per Q&A #44, solution must NOT be SMS-based.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.1 Messaging Capabilities addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Encryption, authentication, audit logging, HIPAA compliance
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Core of Volume I Sections 4 & 5 (FedRAMP and FIPS-199)
requirements: End-to-end encryption (data in transit and at rest)
Comprehensive audit logging (who, what, when, where)
Zero data storage on BYOD devices (Q&A #40)
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL per Q&A #40: Solution MUST support zero data storage on BYOD devices. This is a hard requirement that must be explicitly addressed in Volume I.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.2 Security and Privacy Features addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: VA systems integration, APIs, SSO, directory services
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Volume I Section 1 and D.1 responses must detail integration approach
requirements: Microsoft EntraID (Azure AD) integration (Q&A #42: production only)
rfp_sections.notes: Per Q&A #10: Microsoft InTune integration required. Per Q&A #42: EntraID integration in production environment ONLY (no sandbox).
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.3 Integration and Interoperability addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: User management, reporting, analytics, policy enforcement
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Address in Volume I Section 2 (D.1) and Section 7 (Operations)
rfp_sections.notes: PWS Section B.4.8.7 specifically requires web-based portal for license issuance and renewal. Must be addressed in D.1 responses.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.4 Administrative and Management Functions addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: iOS and Android support, GFE and BYOD compatibility
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Core requirement for Volume I Section 2 and Step 2 testing
requirements: Native iOS app (per Q&A #47: Apple iOS only)
Native Android app (per Q&A #47: Android only)
Support for BYOD (Bring Your Own Device)
App store distribution (Apple App Store, Google Play)
rfp_sections.notes: Per Q&A #47: ONLY Apple iOS and Android required (no Windows Mobile, BlackBerry, etc.). Per Q&A #40: Zero BYOD data storage is MANDATORY. Step 2 testing will use both platforms per Q&A #5.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.5 Mobile Device Support addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Usage metrics, compliance reports, system health, customizable reporting
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Address in Volume I Section 2 (D.1) and Section 7
requirements: Usage statistics (messages sent, users active, peak times)
rfp_sections.notes: Links to deliverables 0002F (Weekly Progress Report) and 0002AG (Quarterly Usage Report).
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.6 Reporting and Analytics addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Section 508 compliance, WCAG 2.0 AA standards
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must explicitly address Section 508 compliance in Volume I
rfp_sections.notes: Federal requirement. Must demonstrate compliance in Volume I. Consider requesting VPAT (Voluntary Product Accessibility Template) from Movius.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.7 Accessibility Requirements addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Phased rollout approach, timeline, change management
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Foundation of Volume I Section 6 (Implementation Approach)
requirements: Phased rollout plan (pilot, waves, full deployment)
Pilot site selection and success criteria
rfp_sections.notes: 90-day timeline is aggressive. Volume I Section 6 must show realistic yet ambitious plan. Reference VA_Resource_Estimate for staffing during implementation.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.4.8 Deployment and Implementation addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: End-user training, admin training, materials, delivery methods
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must detail comprehensive training approach in Volume I Section 6
rfp_sections.notes: Training is critical for user adoption. Plan for 20,000 potential users across 103 sites. Must include security best practices per PWS B.4.12.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.12 Training Requirements addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.section_name: B.4.16 Operations, Maintenance, Sustainment, and Engineering (OMS&E)
rfp_sections.description: 24/7/365 support model, help desk, incident management, SLAs
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Core of Volume I Section 7 (Operations and Support)
rfp_sections.notes: 26 FTE steady-state model defined in VA_Resource_Estimate_RPR_Tech_COMPLETE.md. RPR Tech Tier 1/2, Movius Tier 3. Addresses CLIN 0007 requirement.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.16 Operations, Maintenance, Sustainment, and Engineering (OMS&E) addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Staffing requirements, key personnel, background checks, VA credentials
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must identify key personnel and credential process in Volume I
requirements: Key personnel identification (PM, Technical Lead, Security Lead)
VA credential process (PIV card, SIC fingerprinting)
Replacement approval process for key personnel
rfp_sections.notes: Day 3 deliverable: Contractor Staff Roster. Day 5 deliverable: OF 306 and VA 0710 forms for all staff. Must plan for VA credential process delays.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.19 Contractor Personnel addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: FedRAMP Moderate authorization, continuous monitoring, ATO process
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Volume I Section 4 must demonstrate FedRAMP compliance path
requirements: FedRAMP Moderate authorization OR In-Process letter (Q&A #18)
NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 Moderate baseline controls
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL BLOCKER per Q&A #18: Must provide FedRAMP Moderate certificate OR In-Process letter. Without this, cannot submit proposal. Movius must provide TODAY.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.5 FedRAMP Requirements addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: FIPS-199 Moderate categorization, CIA triad analysis
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Volume I Section 5 must provide complete FIPS-199 analysis
requirements: Security controls tailored to Moderate baseline
rfp_sections.notes: FIPS-199 Moderate is required per PWS B.4.6. Volume I Section 5 must provide detailed CIA triad analysis and security controls implementation.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.6 FIPS-199 Security Categorization addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Complete schedule of all deliverables from Day 1 to Month 12+
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Must commit to all deliverables and demonstrate capability to meet deadlines
requirements: Day 5: Personnel forms, FedRAMP SSP access
Day 10: Implementation Plan, VA Diagram, 3PAO SAP (0002AE)
Day 30: Vulnerability scans, IRP testing, CM meetings
rfp_sections.notes: Deliverables schedule documented in requirements_skeleton.json. Aggressive timeline requires strong project management and coordination between RPR Tech and Movius.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from B.4.5 Deliverables Summary addressed in appropriate volume

requirements: Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) will be designated

rfp_sections.description: Government accounting codes and funding information

rfp_sections.notes: Informs Volume III pricing structure. Base year + 4 option years. Must price all option years.

rfp_sections.description: VA-specific contract clauses: security, COR, key personnel, payment

requirements: VAAR 852.239-70: Security requirements for IT resources
VAAR 852.239-72: Information system design and development
VAAR 852.219-73: VA notice of SDVOSB total set-aside
VAAR 852.232-72: Electronic submission of payment requests

rfp_sections.description: Requirement to disclose violations of law or conflicts of interest

requirements: Disclose violations of Federal criminal law
Disclose civil False Claims Act violations

requirements: Attachment D.1: Functionality Checklist - address ALL items in Volume I Section 2
Attachment D.2: Service Model Questions - answer ALL questions in Volume I Section 3
Attachment D.3: Step 2 Use Cases - prepare test instructions for Step 2 (if invited)

rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from Section D - Contract Documents, Exhibits, Attachments addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Comprehensive instructions for proposal preparation and submission
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: GOVERNS ENTIRE PROPOSAL - must follow all instructions exactly
requirements: Submission deadline: October 31, 2025 at 2:00 PM CST
Submission method: Electronic via email or portal
Volume I: Technical (Phase 1) - 35 page limit, PDF format
Volume II: Past Performance - 10 page limit, PDF format
Volume III: Price Schedule - Excel format (provided template)
Font: 12-point, Times New Roman or similar
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL: ALL formatting requirements must be followed exactly. Failure to acknowledge amendments will result in REJECTION. File naming must be exact.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from E.1 FAR 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: VA-specific modifications to submission instructions
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Additional VA-specific submission requirements
requirements: Step 1 must receive 'Acceptable' to proceed to Step 2
Step 2: 6 trial licenses and written test instructions (if invited)
Proposal volumes as specified in base FAR 52.212-1
rfp_sections.notes: Two-phase evaluation is unique. Must score 'Acceptable' or higher on Volume I to be invited to Step 2. Per Q&A #5: Step 2 testing on Apple and Android devices.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from E.1.1 Addendum to FAR 52.212-1 addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.notes: Standard incorporation by reference.

Section 889 Part B prohibition (as of August 13, 2020)
Must identify any covered equipment in offer

requirements: Disclose civil proceedings and administrative actions
rfp_sections.notes: If no adverse actions, state 'None' for each category. Must be truthful and complete to avoid False Statements Act violations.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from E.1.5 FAR 52.209-7 Responsibility Matters addressed in appropriate volume

rfp_sections.description: Identifies contract as Firm Fixed Price (FFP)
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: Confirms FFP contract type for pricing strategy
rfp_sections.notes: Firm Fixed Price means no price adjustments except for options or modifications. Price must include all costs.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Acknowledged and tracked, no action required

rfp_sections.description: Procedures for filing protests (FAR and VA alternate procedures)
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: No action required - protest procedures if needed post-award
requirements: VA alternate protest procedure per VAAR 852.233-71
rfp_sections.notes: For reference only if protest needed. No proposal action required.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Acknowledged and tracked, no action required

rfp_sections.description: DETAILED evaluation criteria - how VA will evaluate proposals
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: GOVERNS how proposal will be evaluated - write to these criteria
requirements: Sub-Factor 1: Written Technical Approach (Volume I Phase 1)
Factor 2: Past Performance (More Important than Price)
Evaluation ratings: Outstanding, Good, Acceptable, Marginal, Unacceptable
GATE: Must receive 'Acceptable' or higher on Step 1 to proceed to Step 2
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL: Technical Approach is MOST important. Past Performance is MORE important than Price. Price is LEAST important. This means focus on demonstrating understanding and feasibility in Volume I. Must achieve 'Acceptable' minimum rating.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: Acknowledged and tracked, no action required

rfp_sections.description: Comprehensive offeror representations and certifications
rfp_sections.proposal_impact: MUST complete all representations in Volume IV - many are mandatory
requirements: Tax ID number (TIN) and CAGE code
rfp_sections.notes: CRITICAL: SDVOSB status must be verified in SBA VetCert database and SAM.gov. False certification can result in criminal penalties. All certifications must be accurate and complete.
rfp_sections.acceptance_criteria: All requirements from E.12 FAR 52.212-3 Representations and Certifications addressed in appropriate volume

notes: This JSON skeleton provides comprehensive tracking of all 124 pages of the RFP document. Each section identifies data requirements, team assignments, completion status, and whether requirements are already met or statutory/boilerplate. Use this alongside the requirements_skeleton.json to ensure complete proposal coverage. CRITICAL: Focus on sections marked 'pending_movius' and 'critical_blocker' first, as these are blocking proposal completion.
enhancements_applied: Traceability links_to added to all sections
